result.execSummary:
The defendant Jake Harold Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:

Pay all supervision fees. Defendant to make regular payments.
Seek and maintain part time employment, unless a doctor states he is unable to work.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms.
No controlled substances without a current valid prescription, with random drug tests.

Take all prescribed mental health medication.
Inform any doctor that he he is on probation in this case.
Any other counseling or assessments recommended by department.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
AODA assessment and comply with all recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive to: UPFRONT, with release for doctor appointments, and meeting with agent. No electronic monitoring.
Consecutive to: STAYED, to be used by the agent for any violations. Defendant shall serve 10 days for the first violation, and 20 days for the second violation.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jake Harold Smith in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Adam G., careworker.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  If defendant is revoked, same conditions apply to extended supervision as conditions of probation, except for the condition time.

The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 YEARS with the following conditions:

- Serve 30 DAYS UP FRONT CONDITION TIME CONSECUTIVE, in the House of Correction - with release for doctor appointments, and meeting with agent.  No electronic monitoring.

                           ***DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY.***

- 30 DAYS, IMPOSED and STAYED, CONSECUTIVE in the House of Correction to be used by the agent for any violations.  Defendant shall serve 10 days for the first violation, and 20 days for the second violation.
- AODA assessment, and comply with all recommended treatment.
- No controlled substances without a current valid prescription, with random drug tests.
- Take all prescribed mental health medication. 
- Inform any doctor of that he is on probation in this case.
- Seek and maintain part time employment, unless a doctor states he is unable to work.
- Complete 50 hours of community service.
- Any other counseling or assesments recommended by department.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, and assessments, while on probation.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular payments.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.  aw
Information for sentencing, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Jake Harold Smith in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Dennis Murphy for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for sentencing.  Attorney Daugherty has been tied up in another court all morning.  Case adjourned for sentencing on 3/13/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jake Harold Smith
Current: 4337 North 62nd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216 United States  (Effective: 09-30-2014)
Prior: 2434 West Atkinson Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53209

Defendant Jake Harold Smith in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 12/11/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.   
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jake Harold Smith in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case was scheduled for final pretrial and jury trial after the August rotation.  All parties notified effecive August 3, 2014 this case is assigned to Judge Carolina Stark, Branch 17 in Room 313 of the Safety Bldg.  Request for Substitution of Judge Stark received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Stark.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Clare Fiorenza, Br. 3.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 3.  Status conference scheduled for 06-23-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jake Harold Smith in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Nathaniel Adamson for Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
The Court ordered no use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
